cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi NW of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn north-northeast, make landfall in Florida’s Big Bend Monday afternoon, then accelerate northeast across south-central Georgia and the Carolinas into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (Indian Pass–Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Indian Pass to Englewood, FL (Gulf coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida, inland Georgia including Savannah area, coastal South Carolina and North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Tuesday as Colin’s core passes just west of the port; 25 % chance of sustained 34 kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge (generally 1–2 ft) possible with onshore flow, but values over 3 ft are not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain likely as the cyclone’s rain shield sweeps across coastal Georgia Tuesday, producing localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands Monday night–Tuesday.
